Sentencas: La0.8Sr0.2Ga0.8Mg0.2O3-delta (LSGM), a promising electrolyte material for intermediate temperature solid oxide fuel cells, can be sintered to a fully dense state by a flash-sintering technique.
Titulo: Flash-Sintering and Characterization of La0.8Sr0.2Ga0.8Mg0.2O3-δ Electrolytes for Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: In this work, LSGM is sintered by the current-limiting flash-sintering process at 690 degrees C under an electric field of 100 V cm (1), in comparison with up to 1400 degrees C or even higher temperature in conventional furnace sintering.
Titulo: Flash-Sintering and Characterization of La0.8Sr0.2Ga0.8Mg0.2O3-δ Electrolytes for Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: The resultant LSGM samples are investigated by scanning electron microscopy, X-ray diffraction, and electrochemical impedance spectroscopy.
Titulo: Flash-Sintering and Characterization of La0.8Sr0.2Ga0.8Mg0.2O3-δ Electrolytes for Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: The SEM images exhibit well-densified microstructures while XRD results show that the perovskite structure after flash-sintering does not changed.
Titulo: Flash-Sintering and Characterization of La0.8Sr0.2Ga0.8Mg0.2O3-δ Electrolytes for Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: EIS results show that the conductivity of LSGM sintered by the current-limiting flash-sintering process increases with sintering current density value.
Titulo: Flash-Sintering and Characterization of La0.8Sr0.2Ga0.8Mg0.2O3-δ Electrolytes for Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: The conductivity of samples sintered at 120 mA mm(-2) reaches 0.049 s cm(-1) at 800 degrees C, which is approximate to the value of conventional sintered LSGM samples at 1400 degrees C. Additionally, the flash-sintering process is interpreted by Joule heating theory.
Titulo: Flash-Sintering and Characterization of La0.8Sr0.2Ga0.8Mg0.2O3-δ Electrolytes for Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: Therefore, the current-limiting flash-sintering technique is proved to be an energy-efficient and eligible approach for the densification of LSGM and other materials requiring high sintering temperature.
Titulo: Flash-Sintering and Characterization of La0.8Sr0.2Ga0.8Mg0.2O3-δ Electrolytes for Solid Oxide Fuel Cells
